TopicTitle: CONTEST: Kerbal Space Program and Coub invite you to make the perfect loop.

Articles.Content:
<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="360" src="http://coub.com/embed/1njkp?muted=false&autostart=false&originalSize=false&hideTopBar=false&startWithHD=false" width="420"></iframe><br/>ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s that time of year again. The leaves are about to fall. The days are getting shorter. Everything is starting to loop back into the warm arms of fall. Speaking of loops, WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve teamed with <a href="http://bit.ly/1Ba55Ya"><strong>Coub</strong></a> to bring you a contest that will have you looping all over the galaxy.<br/><br/>Whether itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the perfect orbit or the perfect crash, we want you to take up to 10 seconds of video footage and create the perfect loop with it - or a <a href="http://bit.ly/1qm4Be7"><strong>Coub</strong></a>, if you will. Upload it onto the site with the hashtag <strong>#KSP</strong> to be entered into a contest to win a one of a kind drawing by <strong>DanRosas</strong>, autographed by the members of the <em>KSP</em> team.<br/><br/>This contest will run from now until October 2nd. One winner will be chosen from all entries by the <a href="http://bit.ly/1knMaSg"><strong>KSP-TV</strong></a> team. The winner will be announced live on the October 4th episode of Squadcast. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s no limit to the amount of entries you can submit, but make them good and make them count.<br/><br/>Click <a href="http://bit.ly/1oAINpz"><strong>HERE</strong></a> to upload your Coub and enter to win!

Edited September 2, 2014 by Rowsdower
Hmm... Hmm...

I'm somewhat curious as to what happened to modding monday/devnote Tuesday. For now I'll assume that it's because something uber cool is in the works. [sarcasm][speculation] Perhaps it means .25 has moved to experimentals? #hypetrain [/speculation][/sarcasm]
Working on mine already! Just to be clear, I've seen multiple entries by one person. Can you make more than one?

I'm somewhat curious as to what happened to modding monday/devnote Tuesday.

Modding Monday was cancelled because of labor day.

Devnote Tuesday always comes out "late" due to timezone weirdness, but it's still coming. Right, SQUAD? RIGHT!?

Working on mine already! Just to be clear, I've seen multiple entries by one person. Can you make more than one?

Yes you may.

Modding Monday was cancelled because of labor day.

Devnote Tuesday always comes out "late" due to timezone weirdness, but it's still coming. Right, SQUAD? RIGHT!?

Correct on both counts, Nikola. Remember that we post stuff during CDT so time zones will always be wacky.

KSP isn't liking what I'm making... #gamecrash

The hype train never ends.

Does it have to be seamless --- i.e., look *fluid*? Sounds like a cool contest.

Yes you may.

Correct on both counts, Nikola. Remember that we post stuff during CDT so time zones will always be wacky.

Sorry, my impatience was showing...

Remember that we post stuff during CDT so time zones will always be wacky.

Could we get a sticky with a timezone table?

I mean, for us lazy bunch ...

Could we get a sticky with a timezone table?

I mean, for us lazy bunch ...

CDT or Central Daylight Time [Daylight Savings Time] (Summer in North America) = GMT - 5

CST or Central Standard Time (Winter in North America) = GMT - 6

That goes for anywhere in Central US and also includes parts of Mexico including Mexico City.

I dont know...

coub.com is a mess - autoplaying all videos while scolling without the ability to turn it off, even if you register? At least you can mute all videos by muting one...

Does it have to be seamless --- i.e., look *fluid*? Sounds like a cool contest.

Yeah does it have to be seamless?
The Coub website doesn't seem to work on my Windows phone. So, nope.

The Coub website doesn't seem to work on my Windows phone. So, nope.

I'm on my windows phone right now . Yeah Coubs don't seem to load on my Windows phone either. There is a code the moderators just added so you can now embed Coubs to the forum. It's exactly the same as imgur codes but with [coub] instead of [imgur].

I don't think they have to be seamless. I'm making KSP Coubs for fun as well as for the challenge they aren't all seamlessly repeatable.

Hmm...

Coub was founded in 2012 and released an iOS app in June 2013.

Vine was founded in June 2012 and released an iOS app in January 2013. They also released an Android app in... June 2013!

Both are for short video clips or loops, and both names are only four letters. Coincidence?

Also this is like the third contest of the year, and I'm suspecting that Coub paid Squad to start a contest for marketing and stuff. There's probably going to be a fourth, isn't there?

Yeah does it have to be seamless?

As seamless as you can make it, so no, not entirely. Just make it look good

Also this is like the third contest of the year, and I'm suspecting that Coub paid Squad to start a contest for marketing and stuff. There's probably going to be a fourth, isn't there?

Nope. No money exchanged hands here. As luck would have it, though, I am planning another contest after this one ends...
I already uploaded my entry...

Upload question: What file types did you all use when uploading? When I try and upload a straight mp4, coub freezes at 90% and says "it cannot read this file type". I've had to upload them to my Youtube Channel and post a link. Bringing the quality to something like 480...
maybe the file exeeds the size limit... I encode mine as mp4 (h264), 8mb/s, AAC audio 128kbps. 30fps... same setings I use for youtube.

maybe the file exeeds the size limit... I encode mine as mp4 (h264), 8mb/s, AAC audio 128kbps. 30fps... same setings I use for youtube.

Yeah that's the thing. I'm only uploading 20-30 second files at max. It could be that I'm editing in movie maker. :/

EDIT: It may have been because of mm. It worked fine just now. I'm really liking the most recent entries .
